name: Mount Isolation

trails_config.name: Rocky Branch Trail
trails_config.description: A long, deep-wilderness trek to a remote peak. Despite its name, the summit provides arguably the best head-on view of the Mount Washington summit cone and the Great Gulf.
trails_config.parking_info: Rocky Branch Trailhead, NH-16, Jackson, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Isolation rises to 4004 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4004 feet, Mount Isolation is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Rocky Branch Trail**, a **14.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Eisenhower**, which is just 2.7 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
